issues.title: Firewall | Port Forwarding | Able to add duplicated items
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
User is able to add duplicated items - port forwarding rules 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to firewall service
2. Click on port forwarding tab
3. Fill all fields and click on submit
4. Click on New and type the same parameters for new item and click on submit button

**Expected behavior**
User should not be able to add the same rule twice 

**Screenshots**
![dupli](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3385815/84772793-be157f80-afdb-11ea-8c19-c9b2da76f44d.PNG)

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Board Raspberry Pi 3
 - OS version: latest Raspbian 
 - Additional info: Kura 4.2.0-SNAPSHOT

issues.title: "Passwords do not match" Error Although "Wireless Security" Set to "None"
issues.body:
If user mistypes the Wireless password (in "Confirm Pasasword" field), Kura reports an error (Passwords do not match), which is ok, becasue passwords indeed do not match. 
The only problem is that this error persists even if user sets te "Wireless Security" to "None" (see screenshot bellow). 

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to Network -> Wlan0 -> Wireless
3. Enter a valid Password (e.g. "123123123")
4. Misstype the Confirm Password field (e.g. "abcabacab")
5. From "Wireless Security" select "None" and observe the error message above "Confirm Password" 

**Expected behavior**
If you select "None" from the Wireless Security, all the error messages should be cleared. 

**Screenshot:**
![Screenshot 2020-06-15 at 09 51 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/84633634-f9874f80-aef0-11ea-91fd-9ff5dac8903e.png)

**Target Environment:**
Board: Raspberry Pi 3
OS version: Linux raspberrypi 4.19.75-v7+ # 1270 SMP Tue Sep 24 18:45:11 BST 2019 armv7l GNU/Linux
Kura version: 4.2.0_SNAPSHOT ([Link to the specific Kura version -from June 10th, 2020](https://ci.eclipse.org/kura/job/kura-develop/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/kura/distrib/target/kura_4.2.0-SNAPSHOT_raspberry-pi-2-3_installer.deb)

issues.title: No Error When Adding IP Forwarding Port Without Populating Mandatory Fields
issues.body:
User is able to add IP Forwarding port without specifying any of the parameters. Kura reports nothing when "Apply" is clicked and when "Submit" is clicked, Kura reports an error, but nothing happens (if you discard changes, the entry is still there). 
Moreover, if you enter invalid forwarded port and then try to open a port in "Open Ports" tab (which has nothing to do with port forwarding), you loose all the open ports (Open port list disappears - issue #2931).

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to IP Forwarding, try to forward a port without specifying a thing
3. Click Apply and Submit
4. Observe the error when you click Apply
5. Navigate away from this tab, discard changes and then return - the invalid entry is still there

**Expected behavior**
If user does not specify mandatory parameters, Kura should not let him submit the parameters.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot 2020-06-12 at 13 08 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/84496794-e173be00-acad-11ea-8850-df8b5b46e44c.png)

**Target Environment:**
Board: Raspberry Pi 3
OS version: Linux raspberrypi 4.19.75-v7+ # 1270 SMP Tue Sep 24 18:45:11 BST 2019 armv7l GNU/Linux
Kura version: 4.2.0_SNAPSHOT ([Link to the specific Kura version -from June 10th, 2020](https://ci.eclipse.org/kura/job/kura-develop/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/kura/distrib/target/kura_4.2.0-SNAPSHOT_raspberry-pi-2-3_installer.deb)

issues.title: Open Ports Disappear if Error in IP Forwarding
issues.body:
If user enters invalid port forwarding information (see issue #2930), "Open Ports" disapper (after user wants to add a valid open port entry) - screenshot bellow. 

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to Port Forwarding, try to forward a port without specifying a thing
3. Click Apply and Submit
4. Observe the error when you click Apply
5. Navigate away from this tab, discard changes and then return - the invalid entry is still there
6. Go to Open ports, try to add a valid port, click Submit and Apply - observe how Open ports list disappears

**Expected behavior**
Open Porst list should not disappear if user enters invalid information into IP forwarding tab. 

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot 2020-06-11 at 14 58 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/84387971-18859900-abf4-11ea-8e80-84c162e8a393.png)

**Testflow:**

2. Go to Network -> Wifi -> Wireless

issues.title: WiFi Channels 12-14 not usable in AP mode
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
When the max WiFi channel is set to 14, channels 12-14 cannot be used in access point mode.
The table with the possible channels has always 11 rows.

In station mode, it possible to connect to access point using channels 12-14.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Network/wlan0/wireless
2. Click on Wireless => Access point
3. Scroll down to "Channels"
4. No channels 12,13,14 available

**Expected behavior**
There should be 3 additional rows for the 12, 13, 14

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Board I.MX6
 - OS version: Debian 
 - Additional info: Kura 4.0.0

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

issues.title: Kura Stops Responding if Port Number Above 65535
issues.body:
If user enters a port number larger than 65535 (e.g. 999999), Kura stops responding entirely and device needs to be restarted (we get "port out of range" error in the logs, but no warning on the frontend side). The worst thing is that even reboot does not help, Kura has to be reinstalled entirely (at least nothing else worked for me). 
I suggest that we add a check on the Port field to see, if the port number is between 0 and 65535. 

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to HTTPService 
3. Set HTTService to True and Port to 9999999
4. Click Apply and observe the device logs (UI stops respodning)

**Expected behavior**
Se above - port number field should be properly validated. 

**Screenshot:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-27 at 10 47 27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82998025-79637d80-a007-11ea-857a-1d9b62002388.png)

Target Environment (please complete the following information):
Board: Raspberry Pi 3
OS version: Linux raspberrypi 4.19.75-v7+ # 1270 SMP Tue Sep 24 18:45:11 BST 2019 armv7l GNU/Linux
Kura version: 4.2.0_SNAPSHOT ([Link to the specific Kura version -from May 20th 2020](https://ci.eclipse.org/kura/job/kura-develop/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/kura/distrib/target/kura_4.2.0-SNAPSHOT_raspberry-pi-2-3_installer.deb)

issues.title: Password Field Stays in Error State When Changing From WEP to WPA/WPA2
issues.body:
If user first select WPA/WPA2 from Wireless Security Menu, deletes password, selects WEP and then again WPA/WPA2, the error message "Password must be 5, 13 ASCII characters, or 10, 26 HEX characters" stays in place, which is not OK, because this error message should be associate with WEP wireless security and not WPA/WPA2. 

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to Network -> wlan0 -> Wireless
3. Select Access Point Mode
4. Set the Wireless Security to WPA/WPA2
5. Delete the "Password" entry, then delete "Confirm Password" entry
6. Select "WEP" from Wireless Security Menu
7. Delete both password fields 
8. Select WPA/WPA2 again from Wireless Security menu
Observe the error "Password must be 5, 13 ASCII characters, or 10, 26 HEX characters" which is not correct if Wireless Security set to WPA/WPA2.

**Expected behavior**
If user changes the wireless security paramter, the errors should disappear (regardless of the switch; from WEP to WPA or some other switch).

**Screenshot:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-27 at 08 18 04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82985572-8aef5a00-9ff4-11ea-9db4-e019edc5a596.png)

Target Environment (please complete the following information):
Board: Raspberry Pi 3
OS version: Linux raspberrypi 4.19.75-v7+ # 1270 SMP Tue Sep 24 18:45:11 BST 2019 armv7l GNU/Linux
Kura version: 4.2.0_SNAPSHOT ([Link to the specific Kura version -from May 20th 2020](https://ci.eclipse.org/kura/job/kura-develop/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/kura/distrib/target/kura_4.2.0-SNAPSHOT_raspberry-pi-2-3_installer.deb)

issues.title: Syntax Errors in Network Service
issues.body:
There are several syntax errors in Network service that should be fixed (see screenshots bellow).

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to Network -> wlan0/eth0
**2.1** Hover above the "IP Address" field and observe the "information" on the right (Screenshot No. 1)
Text should be: "For static configuration, enter an IP address that should be assigned to the device."
**2.2.** Hover above the "Subnet Mask" field and observe the "information" on the right (Screenshot No. 2)
Text should be: "For static configuration, enter a subnet mask that should be assigned to the device."
**2.3.** Go to Wireless tab and hover above the "Wireless Mode" field and observe the "information" on the right (Screenshot No. 3)
Text should be: "Create a wirelless access point. Specify a Network Name for the access point, then select a Wireless Security type and enter a strong password. Select and fill other options according to your needs."
**2.4**  Hover above the "Radio mode" field and observe the "information" on the right (Screenshot No. 4)
Text should be: "Note that real-world speeds are more modest. Likewise, range varies depending on device configuration and its placement."
**2.5.** Hover above the "DHCP Default Lease Time (s)" field and observe the "information" on the right (Screenshot No. 5)
Text should be: "For DHCP, enter the default time that a client will retain a provided IP address (e.g. 7200)."
**2.6.** Hover above the "" field and observe the "information" on the right (Screenshot No. 6)
Text should be: "For DHCP, enter the default time that a client will retain a provided IP address (e.g. 7200)."

**Expected behavior**
There should be no syntax errors in the Network service.

**Screenshot No. 1:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-22 at 09 15 53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82648041-67ed3080-9c17-11ea-98c5-e1a3ed5c455f.png)

**Screenshot No. 3:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-22 at 10 34 00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82648302-c6b2aa00-9c17-11ea-9302-893a53d549e8.png)

**Screenshot No. 4:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-22 at 09 17 18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82659544-26fe1780-9c29-11ea-98f5-507eaeb6108c.png)

**Screenshot No. 5:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-22 at 10 08 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82659672-590f7980-9c29-11ea-8873-9d000d8e1d8a.png)

issues.title: No Information When Hovering Above "Bgscan Signal Strength Threshold (dBm)"
issues.body:
If user has the option to change the "Bgscan Signal Strength Threshold (dBm)", there is no additional information if mouse is above the field. 
However, if user narrows the window, so the question mark icons appear (you get more info when clicked), there is information regarding this field. 

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to Network -> wlan0 -> TCP/IP
3. Set Status to "enabled for LAN"
4. Go to Wireless tab, connect to a access point (e.g. hotspot on phone)
5. Wait for Ip from DHCP, after that hover above the "Bgscan Signal Strength Threshold (dBm)" field
6. Observe the lack of information on the right side 

**Expected behavior**
If user hovers above the field, additional information should be displayed on the right.

issues.title: Access Point Name Can be Blank
issues.body:
If user deletes the default "Network Name" for Kura's access point, Kura does not report an error when you try to submit the changes. When you search for the "empty" network with your phone, it is not found (which is logical).
I suggest that "Network Name" is a mandatory parameter, or, if user submits an Access Point with empty Network Name, that default one is shown uppon applying changes. 

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to Network -> wlan0 -> Wireless
3. Set Wireless mode to "Access Point"
4. Set Wireless security to "none"
5. Delete the default Network Name and leave it empty
6. Press Apply

**Expected behavior**
See above - either make Network Name field mandatory or set it to default value if user applies changes when the field is empty. 

**Screenshot:**
![Screenshot 2020-05-20 at 08 13 43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15121999/82411304-d85a4d00-9a71-11ea-8992-4efeb1033141.png)

issues.title: Should Empty Login Banner be Allowed?
issues.body:
If user sets "Access Banner Enabled" to True and there is no content in "Access Banner Content" the message displayed upon login is empty - should this be allowed or not? What is the point to show an empty message? 

Also the banner's dialogue box should not be named "Warning" but "Info". It makes more sense?

**Testflow:**
1. Login to Kura as admin/admin
2. Go to WebConsole Service and change "Access Banner Enabled" to True
3. Leave "Access Banner Content" empty
4. Logout and observe the empty banner message (screenshot bellow)

**Expected behavior**
See above.

**Screenshot:**

issues.title: ModemMonitorServiceImpl should use monotonic clock
issues.body: `ModemMonitorServiceImpl` currently computes time differences using `System.currentTimeMillis()`, for example for the modem reset timeout. This can cause issues if system time changes.

issues.title: Entering wrong dial string and APN can cause a reset loop
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
This issue has been encountered with Telit LE910V2.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to modem management page
2. Inser a dial string unsupported by the carrier like `ATD*99***2#
3. See error: Kura will start resetting the modem in a loop that repeats every 30 seconds

**Expected behavior**
It should be give enough time to the user to correct the issue made, while currently if this happens the cellular interface is not always listed in the Kura Admin UI and changing the dial string or APN may not be easy.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Board all the supported target hardware 
 - OS version: all the supported target OSs
 - Additional info: The issue has been observed with LE910V2 but can be extended to all the supported modems

**Additional context**
N/A

issues.title: Kura 4.1.x SupportedUsbModems isAttached method can fail
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
In Kura 4.1.x, the SupportedUsbModems isAttached method relies on the Commons.exec DefaultExecutor to execute the lsusb command needed to understand if the modem is attached. The DefaultExecutor relies on ., if a different working directory is not specified. It may happen that other processes change the working directory and the slush command starts failing

**Expected behavior**
The DefaultExecutor in SupportedUsbModems must be capable to prevent this issue fixing the working directory to a known location

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Board: all the supported boards are potentially affected by this issue 
 - OS version: all the supported OSs are potentially affected by this issue
 - Additional info: 

**Additional context**
The problem seems to be only related to Kura 4.x. The develop branch has not this issue due to the new APIs and cleanup performed few months ago

issues.title: CommConnectionImpl constructor does not close the serial port on failure
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
If the `CommConnectionImpl` constructor is able to create a comm port but the configuration operations performed at [1] fail, the port will not be closed. This can leak resources held by the underlying serial library, such as lock files.

[1] https://github.com/eclipse/kura/blob/2ff4bf772e768658098318e464e430ab30973456/kura/org.eclipse.kura.core.comm/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kura/core/comm/CommConnectionImpl.java#L91

issues.title: Modem reset can lead to SIM card not ready
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
During some stress tests with a Telit LE910C1 we discovered that the modem can start reporting that the SIM card is not ready even if correctly installed.
Currently, in the monitor code, this case does not concur to the reset policy.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Modem working in a tight cycle of resets
2. When the resets are ended the modem reports that the SIM card is not ready even if plugged
3. The modem will not be resettled and will persist this state until manual reset

**Expected behavior**
It can happen, like in this case, that the modem does not identify the SIM card. It is a temporary issue that can be solved by resetting it.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Board Any with a Telit LE910C1
 - OS version: any, not related to the system
 - Additional info: 

**Additional context**
N/A

issues.title: Unescaped loop on modem reset failure
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
Taking as a reference the Telit modem implementation, in case of a reset failure (either in modem turn off or turn on), the surrounding while loop continues to cycle at high speed with the risk of taking all the available CPU resources as well as filling the logs.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. If a modem rest fails, the code will try continuously to reset the modem
2. If the failing status persist, all the CPU and space resources will be filled
**Expected behavior**
The code should be able to manage that condition, at least reducing the loop frequency either to allow the error condition to resolve and to preserve the CPU resources as well limiting the log produced

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Board: any device capable to support an external or internal Telit modem
 - OS version: Any
 - Additional info: 

**Additional context**
Looking at the code, the issue does not only affects the Telit implementation but, for example, also the Quectel one.

issues.title: OPC-UA DRIVER - Return a String Array
issues.body:
---
name: OPC-UA DRIVER - Return a String Array
about: I found a simple solution to return a StringArray from OPC UA.

---

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
My project need to process a StringArray from a OPC UA Server, I found a way to read it.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
On the DataTypeMapper class I insert the following code the map function.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6151744/73543994-e890e280-4416-11ea-884b-438a3a2a45d7.png)
` if (value instanceof String[]) {` 
 `                    String[] stringArray = (String[]) value;` 
 `                    return TypedValues.newStringValue(String.join(",", stringArray));` 
 `               } else {` 
`                     return TypedValues.newStringValue(value.toString());` 
`                 }`



**Additional context**
I have we this demo server to test:  opc.tcp://uademo.prosysopc.com:53530/OPCUA/SimulationServer

The original value reads using Prosys OPC UA Browser.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6151744/73544915-f7789480-4418-11ea-97a5-7471fa03c5ba.png)


I have used this asset configuration to test.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6151744/73544303-a4521200-4417-11ea-9e78-5bc5fafe0344.png)

The result was the values separated with comma as it is represented on the value field of OPC UA browser.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6151744/73544575-3a863800-4418-11ea-89f1-b0ec92545263.png)

It results the same value on the log:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6151744/73544823-c730f600-4418-11ea-9fde-0c10dd046652.png)

issues.title: Check DS dynamic reference bind/unbind methods
issues.body:
Osgi DS spec [1] section 112.5.12 states that when a service instance bound using dynamic references is replaced with another one, the invocation of `bind()` method injecting the new service happens before the `unbind()` invocation for the old service.

We should check existing components that use this kind of references (e.g. wires publisher) to verify if their `bind()`/`unbind()` implementations are compliant.

[1] https://osgi.org/specification/osgi.cmpn/7.0.0/service.component.html

issues.title: Default gateway is not correctly parsed
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
When a network interface is configured as WAN, a default gateway is manually defined and it is directly connected to the device, the following error is reported on the log:

```
2019-09-09T10:00:00,475 [Start Level: Equinox Container: e76e596d-0c32-45dc-b947-808b56c68fcf] ERROR o.e.k.n.ConnectionInfo - Error parsing gateway address!
java.net.UnknownHostException: 192.168.2.1 onlink
	at java.net.InetAddress.getAllByName0(InetAddress.java:1281)
	at java.net.InetAddress.getAllByName(InetAddress.java:1193)
	at java.net.InetAddress.getAllByName(InetAddress.java:1127)
	at java.net.InetAddress.getByName(InetAddress.java:1077)
	at org.eclipse.kura.net.IPAddress.parseHostAddress(IPAddress.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.ConnectionInfoImpl.getGateway(ConnectionInfoImpl.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.NetworkServiceImpl.getNetInterfaceAddresses(NetworkServiceImpl.java:850)
	at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.NetworkServiceImpl.getNetworkInterface(NetworkServiceImpl.java:537)
	at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.NetworkServiceImpl.getNetworkInterfaces(NetworkServiceImpl.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.kura.net.admin.NetworkConfigurationServiceImpl.getNetworkConfiguration(NetworkConfigurationServiceImpl.java:295)
	at org.eclipse.kura.net.admin.monitor.WifiMonitorServiceImpl.activate(WifiMonitorServiceImpl.java:180)
```

It seems that the output of the command is wrongly parsed by `/etc/network/if-up.d/ifup-local`. The command run by the script is:
`ip route show dev $DEVICE | grep default`
where DEVICE is eth0. The output is:
`default via 192.168.2.1 onlink`
The final "onlink" word (that means an address that can be resolved locally) is wrongly parsed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Connect a device (i.e. RaspberryPi) to a laptop that acts as default gateway.
2. Configure eth0 as WAN and set the IP gateway as the laptop address.
3. Apply the changes and check kura.log.

**Expected behavior**
No errors on kura.log

**Target Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - checked on a RaspberryPi 3
 - uname : Linux raspberrypi 4.19.57-v7+ #1244 SMP Thu Jul 4 18:45:25 BST 2019 armv7l GNU/Linux

issues.title: [Kura QA 4.1.0] Emulator in Oomph installer
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
The emulator is broken when Kura workspace is installed with Oomph. The Kura_Emulator_<OS>.launch configuration is wrong since all the bundles are selected.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install Eclipse and Kura using Oomph installer.
2. Start the emulator.
3. See several errors on the console.

issues.title: Kura does not support systems without iwlist
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**

Kura supports using the `iw` tool for scanning but still requires the deprecated `iwlist` tool for probing local wifi interface capabilities (e.g. supported chipersuites).
In particular the method below relies on `iwlist`, it should be adapted to support `iw` as well.

[1] https://github.com/eclipse/kura/blob/480d70ad90ae74389af8dd581470dfe505d3af89/kura/org.eclipse.kura.linux.net/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kura/linux/net/util/LinuxNetworkUtil.java#L636

**To Reproduce**

Remove `iwlist` form a system running Kura.

**Expected behavior**
Kura should is able to manage wifi interfaces.

**Observed behavior**
Wifi interfaces are not shown on web ui, exceptions on the log.

issues.title: Can't set cellular connection attempts to 0
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
In the cellular tab, it's not possible to set the "Connections Attempts" to 0 (that means no limit). This because the webUI validates the value as strictly positive.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Network' and select the cellular interface
2. Set the 'Connection Attempts' to 0
3. See that this error message is shown: "Connection Attempts" must be a positive integer.

**Expected behavior**
It'd be possible to set the value to 0.

issues.title: Unnecessary escaping in Drivers and Assets data UI
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
The driver and assets data section of the web ui reports result data for string channels with some characters escaped.
For example occurrences of the `"` characters will be shown as `"` 

**To Reproduce**
Try to read string data containing characters that can represent xml markup.

**Expected behavior**
Characters are not escaped.

issues.title: Asset operation failure messages are not always shown
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**

Currently a Driver can report a failure state in a `ChannelRecord` by specifying an exception and/or a driver defined message.

The error information provided are not always completely shown in Assets and Driver section in the dedicated popup, for example the exception message can be reported as "Unknown", or empty, even if the driver a non empty message.

If the exception stack trace is not available, the pop up dialog will not appear.

issues.title: [ConfigurationService] Loading unencrypted snapshots discards line breaks
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
Currently unencrypted snapshots are loaded using the `BufferedReader.readLine()` method, which consumes all line breaks, removing them from property values.

**To Reproduce**
Replace `snaphsot_0.xml` with a snapshot containing a string property with a multi-line value.

**Expected behavior**
Line breaks are preserved in configuration property value.

issues.title: BLE Beacon data assembly overflow
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
Beacons have a few fields of limited length reserved for their internal data or user data. Among them are major and minor code, and transmit power. All are Integers in the API. That means that they can reach up to 4B while length limit of those fields is 2B. Since API update is expensive, amend length check in [to2BytesHex()](https://github.com/eclipse/kura/blob/3a4cab4972432194316eb479c5dcb39caa80282e/kura/org.eclipse.kura.linux.bluetooth/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kura/linux/bluetooth/le/beacon/BluetoothAdvertisingData.java#L71) and cut the excess hex characters.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install BeaconAdvertiserExample
2. Enable and set Major to > 65535
3. Apply

**Expected behavior**
Advertised minor and tx power should be as set, but are instead overwritten by major's bytes.

issues.title: Typos in ExamplePublisher metric name and descriptions
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
- metric.double has typo in the name
- metric.integer (including fixed), metric.short (including array) and metric.byte have typos in lower type value ranges

Similar to #889.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install org.eclipse.kura.example.publisher deployment package
2. Add a service based on org.eclipse.kura.example.publisher.ExamplePublisher factory
3. Load its configuration

Option 2:
1. Open org.eclipse.kura.example.publisher.ExamplePublisher.xml metatype

issues.title: [Kura 4.0.0 QA] Shutdown issue when started multiple times
issues.body:
If we start Kura multiple times in succession, shutdown will not be possible due to improper update of kura.pid file due to improper running Kura detection, introduced in commit 6a260660.

issues.title: [Kura 4.0.0 QA] Service disappears from menu when reconfigured
issues.body:
ExamplePublisher disappears when it's reconfigured in a certain way:
* install ExamplePublisher
* add service
* service appears in the menu
* click on it and configure publisher and/or subscriber
* apply and confirm
* service disappears from the menu

It seems to be related to the selection of cloud connection(s). If I update some other parameter, it’s OK. When I change either one of those 2, it happens. Page refresh solves the issue that doesn’t reappear in the next save. The service also reappears if I reconfigure the same or other parameters again. And doesn’t disappear afterwards.
 
e.g. DB server doesn’t have this issue – no cloud connection to configure.

  - Kura version affected: Kura 4.0.0 RC b48
  - OS: Raspbian 9 on RPi3
  - Browser:
    - Name: Firefox
    - Version: 61.0

issues.title: Firewall, "Open port" dialog valiation

When adding a new port to firewall, if port value is incorrect (duplicate), validation message is not presented but dialog does not allow neither to "Submit nor "Cancel".

issues.title: Asset CSV upload/download issues if AD name and id differs
issues.body: If a Driver provides a channel descriptor with ADs defining a `name` different than the `id`, the corresponding columns in the CSV downloaded for an Asset will be empty.

issues.title: [Kura 4.0.0 QA] Adding wires components in IE/Edge
issues.body:
Adding components has new issues in IE and Edge browsers.

IE:
- drag a component to canvas (drop target is not rendered)
- type in the name
- component should show up on the desired place
  - instead the component is out of viewport
- add another component by dragging it to canvas (and entering its name)
  - component should show up on the desired place
  - instead it is rendered next to the previous one and they are both panned into view
- all this repeats

Loggers 1-3 (bottom left) were clicked, the rest (4-9) were dragged to canvas. I used no manual panning until the end when I pressed zoom-to-fit.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22816717/46610998-b4e8c580-cb0c-11e8-85c9-7ea6a03ee4e3.png)

[Edit] Note: IE 11 upd. vers. 11.0.65 (older) on Win 7 behaves as expected i.e. drop targets are rendered and respected.

Edge:
- drag a component to canvas (drop target is rendered)
- type in the name
- component should show up on the desired place
  - instead the component renders centered
- add another component by dragging it to canvas (and entering its name)
  - component should show up on the desired place
  - instead it is rendered on top of the previous one
- add another component by clicking on it (and entering its name)
  - component should show up next to other components and panned to center
  - instead it is rendered on top of the previous one
- view can be panned resulting in the same behavior

4 loggers stacked on top of each other (dragged and/or clicked):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22816717/46610815-1bb9af00-cb0c-11e8-9ab9-c31c33c10e9b.png)


System
- Component affected:
  - [ ] Distribution
    - Platform Raspberry pi 3
    - Kura version affected: Kura 4.0.0 RC b47

  - [ ] Browser
    - Operating system: Windows
    - OS Version: 10
    - Browser: IE upd. vers. 11.0.85, Edge 42

issues.title: [Security] Possible XML External Entity (XXE) attack
issues.body:
An authenticated user can use the "Upload and Apply" functionality of the local Web UI to upload a malicious XML file that can be used, for example, to retrieve arbitrary system files on the device to create DoS attacks.

Kura should be adapted to prevent this type of attack.

References:
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XML_External_Entity_(XXE)_Processing

issues.title: Commit 2149c3280ae38cd77ca5edc619af2b5e80d5668a causes JVM to segfault
issues.body:
The changes in commit 2149c3280ae38cd77ca5edc619af2b5e80d5668a cause the JVM to reproducibly segfault for me.

The segfault happens at a later state. When the JVM tries a hostname lookup, the "dl-init" call on `libnss_dns.so.2` causes a segfault by calling a wrong memory address.

Reverting commit 2149c3280ae38cd77ca5edc619af2b5e80d5668a does fix this issue.

Linker issue with tinyb

Native code library failed to load.
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /tmp/kura/data/org.eclipse.osgi/53/0/.cp/lib/libtinyb.so: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.21' not found (required by /tmp/kura/data/org.eclipse.osgi/53/0/.cp/lib/libtinyb.so)
~~~

This currently breaks CentOS/RHEL. I think this should be fixed before the 3.3/4 release.

issues.title: emitAllReadChannels method doesn't handle Runtime exceptions
issues.body:
The `emitAllReadChannels` method in `WireAsset` class doesn't handle the unchecked exceptions, but only `KuraException`. So, if an unchecked exception as `RuntimeException` is thrown, it is simply passed to the upper layer and this can stop the current thread.

For example, if a Driver doesn't support readings, the `emitChannelRecords` throws an `IllegalArgumentException` that is not caught by the `emitAllReadChannels` method. The results is that the current thread on Wires is closed.

	at org.eclipse.jetty.io.AbstractConnection$ReadCallback.succeeded(AbstractConnection.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.io.FillInterest.fillable(FillInterest.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.io.ChannelEndPoint$2.run(ChannelEndPoint.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.strategy.EatWhatYouKill.doProduce(EatWhatYouKill.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.strategy.EatWhatYouKill.produce(EatWhatYouKill.java:140)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.strategy.EatWhatYouKill.run(EatWhatYouKill.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.ReservedThreadExecutor$ReservedThread.run(ReservedThreadExecutor.java:243)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.QueuedThreadPool.runJob(QueuedThreadPool.java:679)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.QueuedThreadPool$2.run(QueuedThreadPool.java:597)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
```

This is caused by the fact that since the modem has never been enabled, the dial string provided by the Web Ui will be empty (no validation is performed in this case). 
This causes a failure in `PppConfigWriter` that prevents the modem configuration from being persisted, but the GPS will be enabled anyway.

Disabling the GPS at step 4 will fail (nothing happens) because the modem config and the fact that GPS is enabled is not persisted.

A workaround for this is enabling the modem at least once before trying to use GPS.

issues.title: [NetAdmin] Some state of the logic that manages modems persists across resets
issues.body:
A part of the logic that manages modems is provided by the `CellularModem` subclasses, that are instantiated by a `CellularModemFactory` and are cached.
Currently a `CellularModemFactory` always returns the same `CellularModem` instance for a given modem, even if the managed modem has been reset.
This behaviour can cause problems because some of the `CellularModem` implementations keep internal state.

For example, the `TelitModem` class defines a boolean flag that specifies if the GPS is enabled or not, if the modem is reset with GPS enabled and the `NetAdmin` fails to disable GPS, the value of this flag will be retained. This can cause the NetAdmin to incorrectly assume that the GPS is still enabled after the reset even if it is not.

The state of the `CellularModem` instances should be cleared after a modem reset.

issues.title: [NetAdmin] Race condition between NetAdmin and PositionService after modem reset
issues.body:
During the reset of a USB modem with GPS enabled that uses the same port for AT and GPS data, a race condition can occur between 2 threads that contend access to modem serial port.

The process is initiated by the ModemMonitor thread, that resets the modem and immediately enables GPS and posts ModemGpsReadyEvent.
The following threads are involved in the race condition:

1 - the PositionSerivce that handles ModemGpsReadyEvent and opens GPS serial port
2 - the ModemMonitorService.trackModem() method, that runs on an “anonymous” executor, that tries to identify the modem using at commands on the same port.

Thread 2 is the one responsible for tracking modems, it is triggered due the USB events that occur during modem reset.
The race condition can cause PortInUseExceptions in any of the two threads, and further modem resets.

issues.title: [NetAdmin] Fix AT escape sequence timings in TelitModem
issues.body:
The GPS disable logic for Telit Modems currently does not perform a 1 second pause after sending the `+++` escape sequence for switching serial port from GPS to AT mode.
This can cause the ModemMonitorService code to miss the `NO_CARRIER` modem response at the `+++` command and can cause the GPS disable process to fail.

issues.title: [Kura 3.2.0 QA] PositionService does not switch between GPS and static position
issues.body:
Steps to recreate:

1. Connect a GPS device to a Kura device.
2. Enable PositionService and configure to use GPS device.
3. Wait for a GPS fix and check that GPS position is reported.
3. Switch to static position.

Expected behaviour:

Static position is reported in Web UI

Actual behaviour:

GPS position is still reported in the Web UI

issues.title: Factories don't get removed from creation dialog
issues.body:
Using Kura 3.2 RC:

* Install "Example Publisher for Eclipse Kura" from the marketplace
* Open + Dialog, verify the factory ID is present
* Uninstall the example publisher
* Wait
* Reload the Web UI
* Open the + Dialog -> The factory ID is still present

issues.title: Wrong column content in assert/driver view
issues.body:
Maybe it is actually intended that way, but I assume that the content of the Factory PID column in the driver/asset table is filled incorrectly:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/202474/38308169-88c1227e-3816-11e8-956d-0aee9e528f4c.png)

I would assume that the factory PID should be filled with the actual ID of either the OPC UA driver: `org.eclipse.kura.driver.opcua` instead of again the driver service ID.

issues.title: Deleting a component keeps tab open
issues.body:
Tested with Kura 3.2 RC:

* Create factory service instance
* Select service
* Delete service -> tab remains open
* Make changes to configuration
* Press "Apply" -> Error

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/202474/38256300-3b40f8ca-375e-11e8-823d-b9a8fd3cc1dd.png)

I think there are two things wrong here:

1. The service tab should be closed when the service is deleted
1. A proper error message should be shown when the "apply" action fails

issues.title: Unsaved changes dialog triggers incorrectly
issues.body: While testing Kura 3.2 RC I noticed a few times that the "there are unsaved changes" dialog triggers incorrectly. Making a change, pressing "Apply" applies the changes, the "apply" button even gets disabled. Yet the Web UI asks to discard changes when moving away from the service.

issues.title: Array validation doesn't work properly
issues.body:
This is related to DEN-CONF-036, I know it is not part of the test, still I think it is a bug.

The field `metric.short.array` states that is has a range of "Metric range min -32760 max 32760". Entering "32761" causes a proper error to appear, but selecting the next field in the array makes the error disappear again. The (out of range) value can be saves and gets applied to the service:

~~~
2018-04-03 14:22:11,581 [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 7)] INFO  o.e.k.e.p.ExamplePublisher - Update - metric.short.array: [10, 20, 30, 32761]
~~~

I do think that validation checks should be done by Kura configuration service **in addition** to the UI, in order to fix issues like this.

issues.title: Failed NET-WIFI-003 on Fedora
issues.body:
Test NET-WIFI-003 failed on Fedora.

The device never connected to the WiFi. However following test other tests, the device did connect to the WiFi after doing a reboot.

issues.title: [RPI3] Bind permission related issues
issues.body:
- Component affected:
  - [ ] Distribution
    - Installer name kura_3.2.0_raspberry-pi-2-3_installer.deb:
    - Platform (e.g. Raspberry pi 2): Raspberri PI 3
    - Kura version affected (e.g. Kura 3.1.0): 3.2.0
    - Java version (paste the result of **java -version**:
    - Host OS (e.g. Debian): Raspbian
    - Host OS version: Raspbian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch)

  - [ ] Development environment
    - Version: 
    - Operating system (Mac OS, Windows, Linux):
    - OS Version:
    - IDE Version:
    - Host System Java Version:
      
  - [ ] Oomph installer
  - [ ] Add-ons
    - Name:
    - Version:
    - URL:
  - [ ] Eclipse Kura Marketplace
  - [ ] Kura Website
  - [ ] Kura Documentation

  - If needed to replicate the issue, please provide references for the browser used:
    - Name:
    - Version:
     
- Textual description of the issue:

Currently Kura generates the `/etc/bind/named.conf` configuration file using two different templates, depending (at least) on the value of the configuration parameter **Pass DNS Servers through DHCP** in the **DHCP and NAT** section of the web UI.

Both of these configuration file variants specify a custom logging configuration for `named`:

1. If the parameter is set to `false`, `named` is configured for logging on `data/named.run`.
2. If the parameter is set to `true`, `named` is configured for logging on `/var/log/named.log`.

In the scenarios above I've found the following issues:

1. In the first scenario, if the daemon is invoked using `/etc/init.d/bind9 start`, it will fail to start printing the following messages on `/var/log/syslog`:

```
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: automatic empty zone: EMPTY.AS112.ARPA
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: configuring command channel from '/etc/bind/rndc.key'
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: command channel listening on 127.0.0.1#953
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: configuring command channel from '/etc/bind/rndc.key'
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: couldn't add command channel ::1#953: address not available
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: isc_stdio_open 'data/named.run' failed: file not found
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: configuring logging: file not found
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: loading configuration: file not found
Mar 27 06:02:38 raspberrypi named[7768]: exiting (due to fatal error)
```

The daemon start correctly if the following log-related section of `/etc/bind/named.conf` is removed:

```
logging {
	channel default_debug {
		file "data/named.run";
		severity dynamic;
	};
};
```

If the section above is removed bind will use the default logging configuration and forward log messages to the `syslog` daemon.

2. In the second scenario, `bind` is configured to log on `/var/log/named.log`, and to keep 3 backup versions of the file. When the daemon starts it will try to rename `/var/log/named.log` into 
`/var/log/named.log.0`, but it will fail because it does not have the permissions for modifying the `/var/log/ `directory, as it runs as the `bind` user

```
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: generating session key for dynamic DNS
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: sizing zone task pool based on 6 zones
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: set up managed keys zone for view _default, file 'managed-keys.bind'
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: configuring command channel from '/etc/bind/rndc.key'
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: command channel listening on 127.0.0.1#953
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: configuring command channel from '/etc/bind/rndc.key'
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: couldn't add command channel ::1#953: address not available
Mar 27 06:15:45 raspberrypi named[9026]: unable to rename log file '/var/log/named.log' to '/var/log/named.log.0': permission denied
```

This can be fixed as well by removing the logging related section of `/etc/bind/named.conf`. The `/var/log/named.log` is created by Kura installer script, which also changes the ownership of the file to the `bind` user. If the file is removed, `bind` will not be able to recreate it and it will fail to start.

issues.body:
Using the "new component" dialog it is possible to create components with names like `)`, and `"`.

While `)` can be deleted afterwards the `"` (and also others like `&` or `'`) gets expanded to `"` and then can no longer be deleted as a component named `"` doesn't exist. I guess at some point this gets escaped twice.

issues.title: [Wires] Creating a component named ")" is possible
issues.body:
- Component affected:
  - [X] Kura Wires

  - If needed to replicate the issue, please provide references for the browser used:
    - Name: Firefox
    - Version: 58.0.2
     
- Textual description of the issue:

Kure Wires doesn't prevent one from creating a component named `)`. The Web UI fails with an empty stack track. The component gets created:

~~~
{org.eclipse.kura.configuration.ConfigurableComponent, org.eclipse.kura.wire.WireComponent, org.eclipse.kura.wire.WireReceiver, org.osgi.service.wireadmin.Consumer}={kura.service.pid=), service.pid=org.eclipse.kura.wire.Logger-1520846210926-10, service.factoryPid=org.eclipse.kura.wire.Logger, component.name=org.eclipse.kura.wire.Logger, component.id=59, kura.ui.service.hide=true, log.verbosity=QUIET, service.id=184, service.bundleid=116, service.scope=bundle}
  "Registered by bundle:" org.eclipse.kura.wire.component.provider_1.0.100 [116]
  "Bundles using service"
    org.eclipse.equinox.wireadmin_1.0.600.v20150715-1528 [21]
    org.eclipse.kura.wire.provider_1.0.100 [118]
    org.eclipse.kura.core.configuration_1.1.100 [63]
~~~

But it doesn't show up in the Wires canvas.

As `)` will probably break the LDAP style filter for OSGi at several locations, I am pretty sure this will cause other problems as well.

IMHO in the end the Wires framework (NOT THE UI) should prevent creating components with a name like that. Although it will be helpful if the UI prevents that as well. Also see #1955.

issues.title: [DbDataStore] Stale messages not purged with timezone other than UTC
issues.body:
Kura uses a HouseKeeper thread to purge messages from the internal data store once they have been published. The query to find these messages (QoS == 0) is of the form:

`DELETE FROM <table_name> WHERE qos = 0 AND publishedOn <= DATEADD('ss', 5, NOW()) AND publishedOn IS NOT NULL;"`

The NOW() function returns the current time from the underlying OS. However, when updating the "publishedOn" column once a message is published, the Java code uses Date().getTime(), which always returns UTC. Because of this, systems with a timezone set to anything west of UTC will never clear messages from the datastore.

Kura should be able to handle systems with a timezone set to something other than UTC.

issues.title: SystemAdminService.getUptime() returns SystemAdminService#UNKNOWN on MacOS when locale is not English
issues.body:
Since the code to figure out the uptime on Mac uses string pattern matching to parse the result of uptime (which contains "days", "hours", and things like that), it doesn't work when the local is not 'en'.

The implementation should be replaced to use the kernel boottime as a reference and compute the uptime from there (see `sysctl kern.boottime`)

- Textual description of the issue:

Uninstalling and reinstalling the Script Filter dp causes a lot of framework components to be restarted by the Refresh Thread.

```
2018-02-19 14:37:22,860 [Refresh Thread: Equinox Container: 2001f15f-7f15-0018-14db-d15a9290fe56] INFO  o.e.k.c.c.ConfigurationServiceImpl - Registering metatype pid: org.eclipse.kura.wire.CloudPublisher ...

```

The refresh process takes some time, when it finishes, a new component instance is created for each existing factory component configuration. The new instance will have the same `kura.service.pid` as the pre-esisting instace and a different `service.pid`, this can be observed using the OSGi console:

```
osgi> ls | grep CloudService
12	Active		org.eclipse.kura.cloud.CloudService			org.eclipse.kura.core.cloud(bid=63)
14	Active		org.eclipse.kura.core.cloud.factory.DefaultCloudServiceFactory			org.eclipse.kura.core.cloud(bid=63)

true
osgi> comp 12 | grep service.pid
      DataService.target = (kura.service.pid=org.eclipse.kura.data.DataService)
      service.pid = org.eclipse.kura.cloud.CloudService-1519050581560-26

      DataService.target = (kura.service.pid=org.eclipse.kura.data.DataService)
      service.pid = org.eclipse.kura.cloud.CloudService-1519051038972-45
      kura.service.pid = org.eclipse.kura.cloud.CloudService
true
osgi>
```
The duplication seems to be caused by the fact that the ConfigurationService itself is stopped and restarted by the Refresh Thread:

```

issues.title: GSM modems not correctly detected after a reset
issues.body: A GSM modem that provides also net interfaces (i.e. usb0) are not correctly detected after a reset. This is due to the fact that the NetworkServiceImpl is able to detect only tty and block resources. When a net resource added event triggers the NetworkServiceImpl, the resource is added to the block list and the modem is not recognized.

issues.title: NetworkAdminServiceImpl: submitFirewallConfiguration blocks for 30 seconds
issues.body:
Setting the firewall configuration through `setFirewallXxx` methods of `NetworkAdminServiceImpl` always takes 30 seconds.
The `submitFirewallConfiguration` methods waits for an `org/eclipse/kura/net/admin/event/FIREWALL_EVENT_CONFIG_CHANGE_TOPIC` OSGi event but neither `NetworkAdminServiceImpl` subscribes to that event nor the event is raised in that code path.
Eventually the wait timeouts and the method returns.

This bug has been present since KURA 2.0.0 release.

issues.title: [Kura 3.1.0] Build error due to exists-plugin
issues.body:
Currently, trying to build Kura 3.1.0 from the ```KURA_3.1.0_RELEASE``` tag results in a build error like shown below:

```
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time: 25.772 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2017-10-16T15:15:45+00:00
[INFO] Final Memory: 24M/397M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.honton.chas:exists-maven-plugin:0.0.3:remote (default) on project target-platform: Artifact already exists in repository: org.eclipse.kura:target-platform:3.1.0/target-platform-3.1.0.pom -> [Help 1]
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/MojoExecutionException
```

The workaround for this exception is to disable the ```exists-maven-plugin``` both from target-platform/pom.xml and from kura/pom.xml.

This will make the build working again.

issues.title: [Kura 3.1.0 QA] WiFi DHCP: Gateway IP wrong in GUI
issues.body:
Perform test NET-WIFI-001 and move to NET-WIFI-003 (WAN, DHCP, Station mode). Wait for the interface to obtain the IP from DHCP, refresh page to be sure.

GUI shows Gateway is 127.0.0.1 instead of the correct IP; route returns the proper IP/default route.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22816717/31223676-54640c64-a9cb-11e7-9cdc-c365b75d0e0d.png)
```
Destination     Gateway         Genmask         Flags Metric Ref    Use Iface
default         10.242.17.250   0.0.0.0         UG    0      0        0 wlan0
```

Restart Kura.
GUI now shows empty Gateway; route still returns the proper IP/default route.
DNS Servers are not displayed in either case.

GUI should probably display the IP that `route` returns.

Kura 3.1.0 RC b41 on RPi3

issues.title: [Kura 3.1.0 QA] TISensorTag failing read result
issues.body:
Set up a TiSensorTag driver and asset and try to read its data via REST. Log contains the error as in #1704. Channel flag still reports successful read:
`[{"channelStatus":{"channelFlag":"SUCCESS"},"name":"Channel-1","valueType":"DOUBLE","value":0.0,"timestamp":1506584576691}]`

It's probably not related to REST, but is easily observed there.

Kura 3.1.0 RC b40 on RPi3

issues.title: [Kura 3.1.0 QA] Wires page jumping up and down
issues.body:
Open wires graph in a browser window high enough that that graph and component configuration don't fit one page and narrow enough that components are listed on the right of the graph. Open configuration of one of the components and scroll a bit down so that view is not on the top of the page as shown below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22816717/30955945-bd628484-a435-11e7-9bd7-48a34c112ae1.png)

Click on a different component so that its configuration is displayed.

Chrome:
The view jumps to the top of the page and then returns.

Firefox and IE:
The view jumps to the top of the page and stays there.

This result is probably more unsettling in FF and IE as the clicked component is no longer under mouse pointer after I click on it. But double jump in Chrome is also not too nice.

Kura 3.1.0 RC b40 on RPi3 with browsers on Windows

issues.title: [Kura 3.1.0 QA] Rollback doesn't restore deleted services
issues.body:
Encountered during a variation of DEN-SNAP-002 on Kura 3.1.0 RC b40 on RPi3.

* Add a H2DbServer service. Configure it and apply changes.
* Make sure Java listens on the configured port.
* Delete it.
* Go to System->Settings and Rollback to the previous snapshot.
* Refresh page.
* The deleted service is not in the Services list and not started (no listener on the TCP port), but probably should be
* Restart Kura.
* Service is now back.

issues.title: The driver configuration is not applied
issues.body: When a driver configuration is applied from the "Drivers and Assets" tab, the properties are indeed applied. However, if the configuration is applied from the "Driver" tab in the Wires graph, the new configuration is not applied to the driver. It seems that it happens when the "id" and "name" attribute in the metatype are different. When they have the same name, all work fine. Probably, the "Drivers and Assets" tab reads the "id", while the Wires graph reads the "name" attribute causing this problem.

issues.title: Bluetooth notifications do not work
issues.body:
Due to misprint in the `org.eclipse.kura.linux.bluetooth.le.BluetoothGattImpl` class notifications do not work.
Misprint in line 416 `String x = "Notification hanlde = ";` needs to be corrected.

Also, starting from some bluez version `gatttool` uses escape sequences in output. So, the line 417 in same file (see below) works incorrectly:
`String sub = line.substring(x.length()).trim();`
It seems it should be replaced with something like this:
`String sub = line.substring(x.length() + line.indexOf(x)).trim();`
Otherwise handle id cannot be extracted correctly.

issues.title: [Artemis] MQTT clients fail to reconnect after the broker is restarted
issues.body:
Stopping and restarting embedded Artemis broker instances might cause a previously connected client to fail to reconnect.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable the **Simple Artemis MQTT Broker** or the **ActiveMQ Artemis Broker**.
2. Connect a Kura Cloud Service instance to the broker.
3. Stop and restart the broker.
4. Try to reconnect the client.

After repeating steps 3 and 4 a couple of times the cloud service might fail to reconnect.
The Kura log reports this exception:
```
org.eclipse.kura.KuraConnectException: "Connection failed. Cannot connect"
	at org.eclipse.kura.core.data.transport.mqtt.MqttDataTransport.connect(MqttDataTransport.java:333)
	at org.eclipse.kura.core.data.DataServiceImpl$2.run(DataServiceImpl.java:609)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: Invalid client ID (2)
	at org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.internal.ExceptionHelper.createMqttException(ExceptionHelper.java:31)
	at org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.internal.ClientState.notifyReceivedAck(ClientState.java:990)
	at org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.internal.CommsReceiver.run(CommsReceiver.java:118)
	... 1 more
```
The client Id of the CloudService is valid since it has been previously accepted by the broker.
This seems to be caused by the fact that in the [MQTTConnectionManager](https://github.com/apache/activemq-artemis/blob/c8982d775b55849836ae20739a9e82f7eaf1d650/artemis-protocols/artemis-mqtt-protocol/src/main/java/org/apache/activemq/artemis/core/protocol/mqtt/MQTTConnectionManager.java#L43) class there is a static set that contains a list of the connected client ids, a new connection is not accepted by the broker if the client ID is already present in this set.
It seems like this set is not properly cleared, during my tests it always contains the client id of the CloudService that fails to connect even after that the broker is disabled.

The fact that the broker does not accept a connection if there is a client already connected with the same clientId violates the MQTT spec, according to [MQTT-3.1.4-2](http://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v3.1.1/csprd02/mqtt-v3.1.1-csprd02.html#_Toc385349768) the broker should disconnect the existing client and accept the new connection.

The existence of this static set also introduces some coupling between the **Simple Artemis MQTT Broker** and **ActiveMQ Artemis Broker** services: it is not possible to connect to one of the two instances if there is a client already connected to the other with the same clientId.

issues.title: [Assets and Drivers] Byte arrays are not displayed properly
Password arrays are not well managed by ConfigurationService
issues.body: The current implementation of the ConfigurationService does not provide a proper support for Password[]. When one of these is provided, an exception in the OSGi core is thrown.

issues.title: CommandCloudApp doesn't use received working directory parameter
issues.body:
Hi,
In Kura v2, you could send to CommandCloudApp a request with a specific working directory (see `KuraCommandRequestPayload.setWorkingDir()` ).
How can I do the same in Kura v3?

Regards, Diego

issues.title: connect.retry-interval=0 causes DataService activation failure
issues.body:
Setting the `connect.retry-interval` to 0 seems to work until reboot.
After a reboot, the DataService component starts continuously to try to activate, determining the impossibility to use the default cloud service and all the related stack.
I believe the root cause is related to the `IllegalArgumentException` thrown by the [scheduleAtFixedRate](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ScheduledExecutorService.html#scheduleAtFixedRate(java.lang.Runnable,%20long,%20long,%20java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)) .

This determines that the `startConnectionMonitorTask` method throws that runtime exception till going up in the stack-trace at the `activate` level. This causes the component to continuously be restarted by the framework.

I've tested the same behaviour in Kura 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT and Kura 3.0.0. I've not done tests for previous versions of Kura.

issues.title: H2 DB: invalid service configuration not indicated
issues.body:
Configuring H2 DB service as `db.connector.url=jdbc:h2:mem:` (unsupported configuration) reports no error in the web UI. The exception is properly thrown by the H2DbService(Impl) as seen from the log:

```
2017-07-10 12:24:30,041 [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 7)] WARN  o.e.k.c.d.H2DbServiceImpl - Database initialization failed
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Anonymous in-memory databases instances are not supported
        at org.eclipse.kura.core.db.H2DbServiceImpl.updated(H2DbServiceImpl.java:114)
```

My issue with it is that if I don't check the logs, I won't know that there's something wrong with my setup until e.g. Wires H2 DB store will fail. Also, ERROR log level might be justified here as it has wider repercussions e.g.:

```
2017-07-10 12:27:08,487 [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 7)] INFO  o.e.k.i.w.h.s.H2DbWireRecordStore - H2DbService instance found
2017-07-10 12:27:08,512 [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 7)] ERROR o.e.k.i.w.h.s.H2DbWireRecordStore - Error while storing Wire Records...
java.sql.SQLException: Database instance not initialized
        at org.eclipse.kura.core.db.H2DbServiceImpl.getConnection(H2DbServiceImpl.java:172)
        at org.eclipse.kura.internal.wire.h2db.common.H2DbServiceHelper.getConnection(H2DbServiceHelper.java:145)
```

Kura 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT, build 1121, RPi 3

issues.title: [Wires] Deleting a Timer instance might stop all other Timers
issues.body:
In the current implementation the `finalize()` method of the Timer component stops the Quartz scheduler instance shared across all Timers. If a Timer is garbage collected while other instances of this component are running they will stop ticking.
A possible solution could be keeping a static counter of the active timer instances and shutdown the scheduler when the last Timer instance is deactivated.

`org.eclipse.kura.net.admin.visitor.linux.util.PppAuthSecrets.removeEntry(String type, String value)` skips an entry each time it deletes one. Therefore it doesn't remove all matching entries, unless they don't follow each other.

issues.title: Snapshot problem on wires
issues.body:
If for some reason (i.e. a change of a package name of a wire component already present in a snapshot) the web browser cannot reload the snapshot, a GWT exception is generated.
In such a case, a previuos consistent snapshot should be reloaded instead, possibily up to snapshot_0.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Upgrade to Eclipse Equinox Oxygen.2. (#1916)

* Upgrade to Eclipse Equinox Oxygen.2.
This helps with Java 9 compatibility and also brings a more up-to-date version of OSGi SCR in the form of Apache Felix SCR.

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Replace calls to deprecated (/buggy?) ScrService wrapper by proper use of the official ServiceComponentRuntime service

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin-cabe@eclipse-foundation.org.org>

* Replace Equinox DS specific setting by Felix SCR ones.

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Update test to not depend on deprecated/buggy ScrService and use ServiceComponentRuntime instead.

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Fix missing import following rebase on develop.

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Fix inappropriate signatures for bind/unbind methods (should not be public, should not be static).

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>
Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Fix #1414 by removing circular service references in WireServiceHelper#newWireSupport(WireComponent).

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* clean-up test poms

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* update bundle versions in distrib following Kura Wires updates to fix issue #1414

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin-cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Fix travis cache for new Equinox target

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Cabé <benjamin.cabe@eclipse-foundation.org>

* Fix circular dependencies of the ConfigurationServiceImpl

* Changes to have the dev-env and archetype working again.

Minor changes to versions in order to keep consistence.

Signed-off-by: Maiero <matteo.maiero@eurotech.com>

issues.title: [Wires] Fifo is really FIFO only while it's full
[Wires] Null properties in channel configuration are not properly handled
issues.body:
Null properties in channel configuration are not properly managed, even if the property is not marked as required.
This causes various glitches, both in the Web UI and in the configuration management part of the Wires.

issues.title: [Wires] Asset configuration is not updated after a ChannelDescriptor change.
issues.body:
If a BaseAsset instance is attached to a driver, and the channel descriptor of a driver is changed by adding new properties (for example by installing a new version of the driver with a different channel descriptor), the configuration of the existing Asset will not be updated.

The expected behaviour would be that the old configuration of the Asset gets merged with the default values of the new properties (if any) obtained from the channel descriptor.

Currently if the cannel descriptor of a driver changes, the configuration of an existing BaseAsset attached to it will contain null values for the new properties.

issues.title: [Kura 3.0.0 QA] Configuration service: mixing configurable services with factory components
issues.body:
I will describe 2 scenarios that may occur when I want to use ExamplePublisher with Kura 3.0.0. Both show some issue.

Scenario 1:
New Kura installation.
Install example publisher bundle from OSGi console (install file:///.../ org.eclipse.kura.example.publisher-1.0.100.jar). Don't start the bundle, yet. Try to add a new service (+). It's not listed. Start the bundle (e.g. start 95). Try to add it again and now it's listed as a factory component. Don't add it, anyway. Stop and/or uninstall the bundle. Make sure it's not listed in OSGi anymore (`ss` doesn't list it). Try to add the service now – it's still listed as a factory component. It can be added and configured. Configuration service doesn't handle bundle (and factory component, in this case) unregistration.

Scenario 2:
New Kura installation.
Add the old publisher from Amazon and also uninstall it after it publishes a few messages.
Then add example publisher bundle from the jar, available with the build. It's the one that should be started after you create an instance using a factory. But a configuration for the component already exists in the latest snapshot. It will start publishing when you click '+' to add a new service. But you don't have to complete the form – clicking '+' is enough. The trouble is that this one is not configured properly – has no cloud service reference and no app.id.
If you add the new instance, you will now have 2.

Kura 3.0.0 b31 on RPi3

issues.title: [Kura 3.0.0] camel.aggregation and camel.quickstart examples should be "normalized"
issues.body:
These two projects have caused and are causing a couple of problems:

1. After importing the classical user_workspace_archive_3.0.0.zip, they contain errors (see picture below)

![screenshot from 2017-04-20 15 44 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1225835/25233869/9847942e-25e0-11e7-9f85-982e30e1ce42.png)

2. They require an extra manual step when deployed to Nexus which is not required for the other examples. Note that their deployment is skipped by default [1].

I can speculate these problems arise because these examples do not inherit from the kura/manifest_pom.xml and they are meant to be standalone projects.

However, the build is already complex enough and we don't need further exceptions.

@ctron can you please modify these projects to follow the same structure as the others?  

[1] https://github.com/eclipse/kura/blob/release-3.0.0/kura/examples/org.eclipse.kura.example.camel.aggregation/pom.xml

issues.title: [Wires] Wires DataType lacks the KuraPayload float type
issues.body:
Wires DataType only supports double precision floating point numbers (why?).
The single precision floating point type of a KuraPayload cannot be removed for backward compatibility reasons.

* Add the float type to DataType or
* Document that metrics of type float received by a WirePublisher will be converted to a float DataType when converting the KuraPayload to a WireRecord

issues.title: [Net] Network configuration cannot be restored purely from snapshot
issues.body:
Found in Kura 2.0.2. Not checked against Kura 2.1.0.

Let's say you have a configuration snapshot from a golden sample that you want to use it, as snapshot_0.xml,  to seed the initial configuration of like gateways.

This is not possible. You also need to copy the following files:

## Cellular modem

- /opt/eurotech/esf/data/kuranet.conf
- /etc/ppp/peers/LE910_2-1
- /etc/ppp/scripts/chat_LE910_2-1
- /etc/ppp/scripts/disconnect_LE910_2-1
- /etc/ppp/chap-secrets
- /etc/ppp/pap-secrets

and create the ppp0 softlink:

```
ln -s /etc/ppp/peers/LE910_2-1.5 ppp0
```

## Other interfaces
- /etc/dhcpd-eth0.conf
- /etc/dhcpd-wlan0.conf
- /etc/hostapd-wlan0.conf
- /etc/wpa_supplicant-wlan0.conf
- /etc/network/interfaces

## DNS
- /etc/bind/named.conf

## Firewall
- /etc/sysconfig/iptables
- /etc/init.d/firewall_cust  (where needed)

issues.title: [Net] PPP password is not a (MetaType) Password
issues.body:
Found in Kura 2.0.2. Not verified in Kura 2.1.0.

Typically passwords have ``Password`` type and they are base64 encoded in the dowloaded snapshot.
For example (password is "admin"):

```
<esf:configuration pid="org.eclipse.kura.web.Console">
    <esf:properties>
        <esf:property type="Password" name="console.password.value" encrypted="true" array="false">
            <esf:value>YWRtaW4=</esf:value>
        </esf:property>
    </esf:properties>
</esf:configuration>
```

The PPP password is different. It's a ``String`` (not a Password) and not base64 encoded.

```
<esf:property type="String" name="net.interface.ppp0.config.password" encrypted="false" array="false">
    <esf:value>password</esf:value>
</esf:property>
```

Not a big deal since the password is likely stored in clean in the ppp pap/chap scripts...

issues.body:
What happens consistently is that components are placed on top of one another when initially added to the graph. In this case logger was stacked on top of a timer.

FF, Chrome

issues.title: Factory Components Configurations not deleted from the snapshot
issues.body:
When deleting a factory configuration through the `deleteFactoryConfiguration` API, the component configuration is not removed from the snapshot.

The Factory Configuration for the component is then restored at next restart, rendering deletion of Factory Components instances impossible.

Even when uploading a brand new snapshot not containing the configuration of the Factory Components, the merge between the running configuration and the newly uploaded file restores said configurations in the snapshot.

issues.title: [GPS] When GPS fix is acquired, is not possible to switch back to static position
issues.body:
In order to reproduce this issue, proceed as follows:
1. enable the position service and select static position: the static coordinates will be published.
2. disable static position and wait for acquiring a fix from GPS: the new coordinates will be published.
3. switch back to static position: the new static position will NOT be published.

issues.title: Memory leak in ConfigurationService
issues.body: There is a memory leak in the configuration service. To the map `m_pendingDeletePids` items will only be added. But never removed.

issues.title: Memory leak and concurrency issue in 'EventHandlerServlet'
issues.body:
IMHO there is a huge memory leak and beside that a concurrency issue in the newly added `EventHandlerServlet`.

There is only a single queue for buffering events. This queue is unbounded and if no web session reads those events, then the queue will fill up until all memory is used up.

Beside that events which have been sent to one user won't be sent to others.

issues.title: Emulator does not start due to mandatory javax.comm dependency
issues.body: Emulator (only tested in OSx) does not start due to mandatory dependency of `javax.comm` in API bundle. The OSGi runtime could not find any bundle exporting `javax.comm`, hence all the transitive and intransitive bundles failed to start. Just for a quick test, I have set `javax.comm` as an optional package in API bundle which resulted in successful start of the emulator.

issues.title: org.eclipse.kura.asset.provider provides API and service implementation
issues.body:
The bundle `org.eclipse.kura.asset.provider` provides base classes and a service implementation at the same time. That way it is impossible to exchange the service implementation with a different implementation.

As we are using OSGi we should follow the idea of splitting up API/base classes and internal service implementation.

Currently the "web" bundle requires a reference to `org.eclipse.kura.asset.provider` in order to use `BaseChannelDescriptor` and thus Kura an only be used with the single implementation of `org.eclipse.kura.asset.provider`.

issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] Problems with installation of Kura on BeagleBone Black
issues.body:
Issues with the [documentation](https://eclipse.github.io/kura/doc/beaglebone-quick-start.html):
- Required dependencies are not listed: isc-dhcp-server, dos2unix, bind9, bind9utils, unzip, ethtool and telnet
- The "connman" service needs to be disabled, otherwise the network configuration functionality of Kura doesn't work.
- The systemd's time-sync service needs to be disabled, otherwise it interferes with the time sync. functionality of Kura.

Installation issues:
- Install log (kura_install_<ts>.log) errors:
    ```
    cp: cannot create regular file '/var/named/': Not a directory
    ```
- Console log (kura-console.log) errors:
    A lot of exceptions were thrown and it looks like the reason is this (workaround can be found in #548):
    ```
    Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /tmp/.kura/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/62/1/.cp/lib/linux/armv6_hf/libEurotechLinuxUdev.so: libudev.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
    ```
- Because of the issue from above web interface doesn't load.

Kura 2.1.0 build 15 on BeagleBone Black

issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] Wrong range messages
issues.body:
This applies to all range validation messages.

When entering "-2147483601" as a value for "integer" you get the following message: "Value must be greater than -2147483600".

However "-2147483600" already is a valid message, but it is not greater than "-2147483600".

issues.title: DEN-CONF-005 Wrong range limit for "long"
issues.body:
In test DEN-CONF-005 the limit for "long" is -4294967296 max 4294967296.

However the 64bit Java long is actually: 9223372036854775807L to -9223372036854775808L [1]

[1] https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/constant-values.html#java.lang.Long.MAX_VALUE

issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] DEN-CONF-005: Internal message when a "too big" number is entered
issues.body:
Entering 4294967297 shows a correct error message.

Entering 429496729733333333333 as a number shows the message: `For input string: "-429496729733333333333"`

issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] Refreshing configuration in web UI
issues.body:
Forms are not properly refreshed with applied data when configuration is updated.

Example:
* Procedure:
  * System-Cloud Services->DataService
  * update connect.retry-interval from 60 to 600
  * Apply
  * update disconnect.quiesce-timeout from 10 to 100
  * Reset

* Expected results:
  * connect.retry-interval is 600
  * disconnect.quiesce-timeout is 10

* Actual results:
  * connect.retry-interval is 60
  * disconnect.quiesce-timeout is 10

If I refresh the page, it's OK.

Similar to #890.

Kura 2.1.0 build 12, Raspberry Pi 3, Firefox, Chrome, IE

issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] Snapshot management in web UI
issues.body:
DEN-SNAP-002 from #788 requires snapshot to be rolled back. The UI mentions possibility of a timeout after which manual refresh is necessary.

The issue is that the timeout probably didn't occur - it was definitely not indicated in any way in the UI, and the operation was rather fast - but UI data was not refreshed. ExamplePublisher's configuration remained as it was before the rollback until manual page refresh. And that happened every time I tried.

The same goes for snapshot file upload.

Kura 2.1.0 build 12, Raspberry Pi 3

issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] Denali Configuration ExamplePublisher error descriptions
issues.body:
Error messages are misleading for long, integer, short, double, float, byte: message says 'smaller', but should be 'smaller or equal' on the high limit, and 'greater' where it should be 'greater or equal' on low limit. It could otherwise specify a different (higher/lower) number (e.g. 4294967297 for long).

Test cases DEN-CONF-005 - DEN-CONF-029 from #788.

Other notes on these tests:
DEN-CONF-016 reports `For input string: "32768"` instead of expected `Value out of range. Value: 32768…`
DEN-CONF-027 mentions `Byte min -127 max 127.` which only confuses the users as those values are not allowed.
DEN-CONF-029 reports `For input string: "128"` instead of expected `Value out of range. Value: 128…`.

DEN-CONF-035 expects dirty flag on the fields. It is not visible in Firefox, Chrome or IE.

issues.title: Invalid field validation state when switching from WAN to LAN
issues.body:
In the network UI:

Pre-conditions:
* eth0 is configured for WAN with DHCP

Steps:
* Select "manual" for eth0
* Clear the "gateway" field, may already be empty
* Press save -> error, OK
* Select "LAN" for eth0
* Press save -> error -> NOT OK

The field is no longer required when the mode is switched from WAN to LAN, but the field validation is not reset.

issues.body:
Test case NET-ETH0-011 from #788 includes the following configuration:

On Network->eth0 DHCP & NAT page, set the following
Router Mode: DHCP and NAT
DHCP Beginning Address: 192.168.1.10
DHCP Ending Address: 192.168.1.254
DHCP Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
DHCP Default Lease Time: 900
DHCP Max Lease Time: 900
Pass DNS Servers through DHCP: yes

When this is applied, the test case expects the bind (named) to run. What actually happens is that named runs before and is stopped after.

Kura 2.1.0 build 12, Raspberry Pi 3, `Linux raspberrypi 4.1.18-v7+ #846 SMP Thu Feb 25 14:22:53 GMT 2016 armv7l GNU/Linux`
