issues.title: [Kura 2.1.0 QA] eth0 netmask configuration
issues.body:
2 similar cases are covered:

1. 16-bit netmask

Disable eth0 interface in Kura web UI.
Apply the configuration. Interface is not actually disabled (#876).
Now configure it as:
  * Enabled for WAN
  * Manually
  * add IP Address and Gateway IP
  * add netmask 255.255.0.0

Apply configuration.
As a result the actual applied netmask will be 255.255.255.0 and Kura's config will show 255.255.0.0.

2. 32-bit netmask

Disable and later configure eth0 as before.
This time set netmask to 255.255.255.255.
Apply configuration.
As a result the actual netmask will be 255.255.255.0 and Kura's config will show an empty field.

Note:
Netmask is properly applied only after IP Address is also updated. In case of 255.255.255.255 is is still not shown in web UI.

Kura 2.1.0 build 12, Raspberry Pi 3, fully updated `Linux raspberrypi 4.1.18-v7+ #846 SMP Thu Feb 25 14:22:53 GMT 2016 armv7l `

issues.title: Version problems for org.eclipse.kura.api
issues.body:
Currently both `release-2.1.0` and `develop` declare version `1.0.10` for `org.eclipse.kura.api`.

However the content is actually different and the "release" branch is missing the wires additions.

This causes the problem locally when you are working with both versions that Maven will choose 1.0.10 over 1.0.10-SNAPSHOT, so the Web UI module doesn't compile anymore.

IMHO the version for `org.eclipse.kura.api` should be `1.1.0` now.

issues.title: libhidapi not correctly compiled for armv5
issues.body:
The libhidapi.so library is not correctly compiled for armv5 platforms.
The programs that use it output a "Illegal instruction" error.

issues.title: [DbDataStore] repair is very slow on big tables
issues.body:
The ``repair`` operation contains a DB query to detect duplicates of the primary key (which should not occur).
The operation was added due to this [bug](https://sourceforge.net/p/hsqldb/discussion/73674/thread/a08046eb/).

The query has shown to take a very long time (in the order of minutes) on relatively large **file** databases (for example enabling the "almost persistent" configuration in kura.properties).

The bug is only known to happen on certain gateways using a raw flash storage configuration.

Since these gateways are no longer supported, the ``repair`` could be executed only once on startup maybe subjected to a configuration parameter.

issues.title: [DbDataStore] defrag and checkpoint are not per-table operations
issues.body:
DbDataStore exposes two methods ``defrag`` and ``checkpoint`` that act on the entire DB and not on the DB table associated with the DbDataStore.
When multiple ``DbDataStore`` instances exists (since the introduction of the multiple cloud connections feature), each ``HouseKeeperTask`` instance will periodically call ``defrag``, potentially concurrently.

issues.title: Unable to configure CloudService instance when component gets unregistered
issues.body:
I think this is the same situation as with the `ConfigurableComponent`. If the `CloudServiceFactory` wants to create a new instance, it **must** result in the creation of a CloudService instance with OSGi, if it is usable or not. Otherwise the Mulit-Cloud-Service Web UI can no longer configure the instance in order to correct the issue.

To me it looks like the issue with `ConfigurableComponent` was just ported over to the Multi-Cloud-Service Web UI.

issues.title: Serial receive timeout is not forwarded to javax.comm.CommPort
issues.body:
The timeout parameter specified in a CommURI currently is not forwarded to javax.comm.CommPort and so the read() calls performed on an ImputStream associated with a serial port will not time out.
The timeout can be enabled using the javax.comm.CommPort.enableReceiveTimeout() method.

issues.title: Misconfiguration of eth0 (as dhcp server) filling /var/log directory and finally crashing kura
issues.body:
After a incorrect configuration applied on eth0 (enabled for LAN with a manual address 10.129.3.2 AND DHCP and NAT enabled with a pool range 172.16.0.100 - 172.16.0.110), Kura try to start dhcpd but dhcpd is failing and reporting the following error in syslog and daemon.log: 

Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: Internet Systems Consortium DHCP Server 4.2.4-P1
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: Copyright 2004-2012 Internet Systems Consortium.
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: All rights reserved.
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: For info, please visit https://www.isc.org/software/dhcp/
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: bad range, address 172.16.0.100 not in subnet 10.129.3.0 netmask 255.255.255.0
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: 
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: If you did not get this software from ftp.isc.org, please
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: get the latest from ftp.isc.org and install that before
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: requesting help.
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: 
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: If you did get this software from ftp.isc.org and have not
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: yet read the README, please read it before requesting help.
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: If you intend to request help from the dhcp-server@isc.org
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: mailing list, please read the section on the README about
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: submitting bug reports and requests for help.
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: 
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: Please do not under any circumstances send requests for
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: help directly to the authors of this software - please
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: send them to the appropriate mailing list as described in
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: the README file.
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: 
Oct 18 23:18:53 rg-10-20 dhcpd: exiting.

Kura Network monitor is retrying every mn and after a few hours the log files become very large and fill all the disk space. When there is no more space left on the disk, Kura stops working until the disk is freed.

There are actually 2 issues here:
- the log files should not fill the disk. This is fixed with a correct logrotate policy
- an incorrect network configuration should not be retry forever.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Merge pull request #648 from ctron/feature/fix_issue_641

#641: Check connection state before trying to subscribe

#641: Check connection state before connecting

This change does perform a check first if the connection is establed.

This is not a 100% guarantee that the next call will succeed, bit it
should indeed catch most of the cases. If, on the other hand the state
is false and suddenly pops up, the callback should cover that case.

issues.title: [Modem] NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.modem.SupportedUsbModems
issues.body:
This issue is caused by commit 9f5870537e36afa6641dc6d3d237686e82407f02 
Everything works right if the device has no internal modem, while, if the modem is available, the execution will stop at boot due to a `NoClassDefFoundError` on class `org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.modem.SupportedUsbModems`.

The issue is triggered by `SupportedUsbModemsInfo.isSupported` that tries to call `SupportedUsbModems.isSupported`. Before executing the `isSupported` method, the `SupportedUsbModems` static block will invoke `getLsusbInfo` that will call `LinuxProcessUtil.startWithStats`. 
The static block in `LinuxProcessUtil` modified by 9f5870537e36afa6641dc6d3d237686e82407f02 tries to get a service reference of the `SystemService`, but the result of this invocation is a null value. This is due to the fact that the `SystemService` component definition has a dependency on the `NetworkService`, but the network service needs the `SystemService` to execute: an indirect dependency loop is generated in this way, preventing the code to execute properly.

@ctron Could you take a look at this?

issues.title: WebUI fails completely is `PositionService` is not registered
issues.body:
If there is no instance of `PositionService` registered with OSGi, then the whole Web UI fails with an "internal error".

Although the code checks for a `null` reference:

``` java
PositionService positionService = ServiceLocator.getInstance().getService(PositionService.class);

if (positionService != null) {
```

The actual call to `org.eclipse.kura.web.server.util.ServiceLocator.getService(ServiceReference<T>)` will throw an exception.

issues.title: Replace all calls to ConfigurationAdmin.getConfiguration(String)
issues.body:
All calls to `org.osgi.service.cm.ConfigurationAdmin.getConfiguration(String)` should be replaced to calls of `org.osgi.service.cm.ConfigurationAdmin.getConfiguration(String, String)` providing `null` as the location parameter.

Most calls in Kura already are already migrated to that call, but not all. Using Apache Felix ConfigAdmin actually enforces the default binding which is generated otherwise and will not configure some components. Also see OSGi spec for `getConfiguration(String)`:

> Bind its location to the calling bundle's location.

That effectively binds the configuration to the Kura configuration bundle which is wrong. It should instead be bound to the bundle containing the service. Leaving the argument `null` would do that automatically once the service is registered.

issues.title: Services UI not getting updated with new properties
issues.body:
Any Service UI in the Web Console is not reflecting the updated changes of its properties even if I change it from the Web Console. I tried to change few properties in the Web Console and the properties are actually getting updated in OSGi but the updated properties are not shown on the respective Service UI in Web Console.

**For example**, CloudService -> device.display-name

**N.B**: The input box properties are the only ones which reflect the changes on Service UI but not the dropdown properties.

issues.title: [Modbus] Refactoring of Modbus example
issues.body:
We have currently 2 projects that are Modbus examples : org.eclipse.kura.protocol.modbus.test and examples/org.eclipse.kura.demo.modbus. 

examples/org.eclipse.kura.demo.modbus is old and buggy and needs some refactoring. 

org.eclipse.kura.protocol.modbus.test is actually the old devkit program and is doing a bit more than modbus example, demonstrating the remote control of the device using MQTT. Moreover, this program has been updated and is now available in the public repository edc-examples:
https://github.com/eurotech/edc-examples/tree/master/com.eurotech.framework.edcdevkit

I propose that we keep only one Modbus example in examples directory  (after refactoring) and that we suppress the modbus.test project in kura.

Tell me what you think.

issues.title: Device -> Threads shows empty list
issues.body: Opening the Web UI 2 view "Devices" -> "Threads" shows an empty list/table.

issues.title: [Net] PppFactory is not a factory and its design is wrong
issues.body:
`PppFactory` is used by `ModemMonitorServiceImpl` to both create new instances and return already created instances. There are several defects:
1. It's not a factory. It's more similar to the [Multiton Pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiton_pattern).
2. `obtainPppService(String iface, String port)` is misleading and error prone. Internally only the interface name, for example `ppp0` is used as the key.

The above can lead to the following scenario:
- Initially `obtainPppService(ppp0, /dev/ttyACM0)` creates a new `IModemLinkService` instance for the interface `ppp0` running on the modem serial port `/dev/ttyACM0`. This instance is tracked internally by PppFactory by the interface name `ppp0`. The monitor will spawn `pppd` on `/dev/ttyACM0`
- The modem gets reset/unplugged (for any reason). On Linux is entirely possible that the serial port device name changes for example to `/dev/ttyACM1`.
- In the next loop iteration the monitor will call `obtainPppService(ppp0, /dev/ttyACM1)` again but this will return the previous instance since the serial port name does not matter. The monitor will spawn `pppd` on `/dev/ttyACM0` which is clearly wrong.

issues.title: [Net] Modem monitor concurrency issue with multiple modems
[Web 2] ServicesUi validation
issues.body:
The validation step for the fields in ServicesUI is performed only onValueChange. This means that if a  required field is empty but is not changed by the user, the validation will not be performed and the configuration will be accepted.

The isValid check should go through all the fields and evaluate if they are in a correct state.

issues.title: SystemServiceImpl uses method from Java  7 but declares a BREE of Java 6
issues.body:
org.eclipse.kura.core.system.SystemServiceImpl makes a call to  `java.net.NetworkInterface#getIndex()` [1] which is only available since Java 7.

However the bundle declares an execution environment of Java 6.

[1] http://download.java.net/jdk7/archive/b123/docs/api/java/net/NetworkInterface.html#getIndex%28%29

issues.title: Command cloud App Null Pointer Exception
issues.body:
Hi all,

I've found a problem with Kura v1.4.0. 

I'am working with the CMD-V1 application installed on Kura 1.4.0, trying to replicate the cloud management for the command. 

The problem was showing when I was missing the metric `command.command` in the message payload sent to the device and this was causing a Null pointer exception on the device and it was not responding with an error message. 

Here is the stacktrace:

> 2016-08-30 10:01:39,490 [pool-1-thread-2] ERROR o.e.k.c.a.c.CommandCloudApp - null command
> 2016-08-30 10:01:39,491 [pool-1-thread-2] ERROR o.e.k.c.a.c.CommandCloudApp - Error executing command {}

Regards, 

_Alberto_

issues.title: Change b02bc9a7615ca559349f2b05485ea84fd80d6e77 breaks deployment of "sun.misc" bundles
issues.body:
I think it was the change b02bc9a7615ca559349f2b05485ea84fd80d6e77 which does change the bundle versions of the two "sun.misc" fragments to "-SNAPSHOT", breaking the deployment.

However the Kura "distrib" scripts cannot handle non-Tycho bundles with "_SNAPSHOT". It get's converted to ".SNAPSHOT". This causes the following error during startup:

```
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2016-08-29 14:41:54.372
!MESSAGE Bundle reference:file:/opt/eclipse/kura/plugins/org.eclipse.kura.sun.misc_1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar@1 not found.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2016-08-29 14:41:54.633
!MESSAGE Bundle reference:file:/opt/eclipse/kura/plugins/org.eclipse.kura.camel.sun.misc_1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar@3 not found.

```

issues.title: Kura makes use of system properties when filtering for native code libraries which is not supported
issues.body:
At several locations Kura filters for native code libraries using system properties (kura.arch), however that is not supported by OSGi, still it works with Equinox 3.8.1. It is only possible to filter for "launching properties".

However other OSGi implementations more recent Equinox version don't support this anymore and fail to load the native libraries.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
#476: Split up USB native code into different fragments

Signed-off-by: Jens Reimann <jreimann@redhat.com>

issues.title: Beaglebone install script not creating /etc/sysconfig

I successfully installed my bundle on Kura gateway on my Raspberry Pi (https://eclipse.org/kura/downloads.php -> Raspbian (Model 2) - Stable version). 
When I start the bundle, no errors are shown and the bundle changes to state ACTIVE.

In the kura.log following entry is added: 
INFO  o.e.k.c.c.ConfigurationServiceImpl - Registering metatype pid: org.eclipse.kura.core.cloud.watsoniot.WatsonIoTCloud with ocd: org.eclipse.kura.core.configuration.metatype.Tocd@b55bde ...

Then I switch to the Web UI, select "Status" -> "Connect" the newly installed bundle for cloud connection does not show up. 

Is there a way to activate the bundle over console? If yes, how?  Can I deactivate in the meantime the default bundle so that only my bundle is connected to Watson IoT (cause both would use the same MqttDataTransport configuration...

Thank you for your help!

issues.title: iwScanTool fails to parse scan results
issues.body:
There's a network in my area which causes iwScanTool to fail when parsing the results of `iw dev wlan0 scan`.

The following error is produced:

```
2016-08-02T09:07:46.384Z [qtp27081630-40] WARN org.eclipse.kura.web.server.util.KuraExceptionHandler - RPC service non-application error
  org.eclipse.kura.KuraException: An internal error occurred. scan operation has failed
...
...
  Caused by: org.eclipse.kura.KuraException: An internal error occurred. error parsing scan results
    at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.util.iwScanTool.scan(iwScanTool.java:162)
    at org.eclipse.kura.net.admin.NetworkAdminServiceImpl.getWifiHotspots(NetworkAdminServiceImpl.java:1161)
    ... 38 more
  Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "IBSS"
    at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.readJavaFormatString(Unknown Source)
    at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.parseFloat(Unknown Source)
    at java.lang.Float.parseFloat(Unknown Source)
    at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.util.iwScanTool.parse(iwScanTool.java:372)
    at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.util.iwScanTool.scan(iwScanTool.java:160)
    ... 39 more
```

The failure is caused by the following item in the list:

```
BSS 00:11:22:33:44:55(on wlan0)
    TSF: 10275279415182 usec (118d, 22:14:39)
    freq: 2412
    beacon interval: 100 TUs
    capability: IBSS Privacy (0x0012)
    signal: -84.00 dBm
    last seen: 8070 ms ago
    Information elements from Probe Response frame:
    SSID: TheSSID
    Supported rates: 1.0* 2.0 5.5 11.0 6.0 9.0 12.0 18.0 
    DS Parameter set: channel 1
    IBSS ATIM window: 0 TUs Extended supported rates: 24.0 36.0 48.0 54.0 
    WMM: information: 01 00
```

Specifically, the line:
`IBSS ATIM window: 0 TUs    Extended supported rates: 24.0 36.0 48.0 54.0`

This seems like a bug in iw (version 3.11), and it is really supposed to be two separate lines.
Even so, we can handle this situation better in Kura: https://github.com/eclipse/kura/blob/KURA_1.4.0_RELEASE/kura/org.eclipse.kura.linux.net/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kura/linux/net/util/iwScanTool.java#L371

issues.title: [BLE] BluetoothGattImpl.getCharacteristics(String startHandle, String endHandle) and getServices() methods return empty list
issues.body:
It seems that ANSI Escape sequences send by gatttool (according to https://git.kernel.org/cgit/bluetooth/bluez.git/tree/attrib/interactive.c) remain in strings treated by BluetoothGattImpl.

Response data filter corresponding to `getCharacteristics` is `startsWith("handle:")`  but received string begin by `[Khandle:` (with [K from the erase line escape sequence). So the method returns an empty list.

Likewise for `getServices`.

Kura version : 2.0.0
Bluez version : 5.23
Plateform : Raspberry Pi 3 with Linux raspberrypi 4.4.11-v7+

issues.title: createFactoryConfiguration seems to always save snapshots
issues.body:
The new `createFactoryConfiguration` method in the CloudService generates a snapshot even if the `takeSnapshot` flag is set to false.

e.g. when creating a new communication stack, the result is three new snapshots in the snapshots folder, instead of just one, as expected.

On another note, the `deleteFactoryConfiguration` seems to correctly handle the `takesnapshot` flag.

issues.title: [Web2]: Setting the "name" property to anything different than the "id" sets an empty value
[Configuration] Metatype not updated in the Web UI
issues.body:
How to recreate:
1. Install a Deployment Package containing a bundle with a ConfigurableComponent
2. Update the metatype of the ConfigurableComponent, for example by changing the description in an `AD` element
3. Uninstall/Install the Deployment Package again
4. The metatype is not updated in the Web UI until Kura is restarted

I guess it's a bug of the ConfigurationService.

issues.title: [Web2]: String input forced to a maximum length of 255
issues.body:
Input fields of type "String" are forced to a maximum limit of 255 characters. Although components may specify more in their metatype description, the following code will not allow text input with more than 255 characters:

``` java
if ((String.valueOf(box.getText().trim()).length()) > Math.min(configMaxValue, 255)) {
```

issues.title: [Web2]: Field validation errors not shown
issues.body:
If a field validation fails the error message for that field is not shown.

The error message if set using `setPlaceholder`, which sets the text in case the field is empty. However in most cases the field is not empty when data validation fails.

While I would prefer to have a separate box, it should be set at least using `setTitle` in order to have the error message in the tooltip.

issues.title: Debian package should declare dependency on java
issues.body:
Copied over from: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=497749

Since the Kura platform does require Java as a runtime it should declare a dependency on `java7-runtime-headless`, which will provide a suitable JRE.

Currently the Kura package only depends on:

   hostapd, isc-dhcp-server, iw, dos2unix, bind9, unzip, ethtool, telnet

issues.title: [Multiple Cloud Connections] Spurious component reactivations upon configuration change
issues.body:
Multiple connections: updating a service (e.g. MqttDataTransport) of a connection
has the effect to cause the unwanted reactivation of the next higher layer service (i.e. DataService)
of the other connection(s). This in turn will cause the reactivation of all dependent components.
This is not desired and not yet understood (Equinox bug?).

issues.title: CloudCallService overrides client ID
issues.body: The current implementation of CloudCallService overrides the requester client ID with "#client-id" in the passed in KuraRequestPayload. This causes the remote Kura device to respond to the wrong control topic. This should be updated to only call setRequesterClientId() if the KuraRequestPayload is null.

issues.title: DEPLOY-V2 documentation incorrect
issues.body:
After testing out this feature I found a few behaviours which do not match the documentation at https://eclipse.github.io/kura/ref/mqtt-namespace.html#deploy-v2
1. "job.id" is missing.
2. "dp.download.protocol" should not say "default HTTP" this suggests it is not mandatory. Maybe "e.g. 'HTTP'" would be better, or make it default/non-mandatory in the implementation.
3. "dp.install.system.update" should state "mandatory", or default to "false" in the implementation.

issues.title: OSGi console "help" command fails
issues.body:
```
osgi> help 
---Extension Registry Commands---
    ns [-v] [name] - display extension points in the namespace; add -v to display extensions
    pt [-v] uniqueExtensionPointId - display the extension point and extensions; add -v to display config elements

---Service Component Runtime---
    list/ls [-c] [bundle id] - Lists all components; add -c to display the complete info for each component;
            use [bundle id] to list the components of the specified bundle
    component/comp <component id> - Prints all available information about the specified component;
            <component id> - The ID of the component as displayed by the list command
    enable/en <component id> - Enables the specified component;
            <component id> - The ID of the component as displayed by the list command
    disable/dis <component id> - Disables the specified component;
            <component id> - The ID of the component as displayed by the list command
    enableAll/enAll [bundle id] - Enables all components; use [bundle id] to enable all components of the specified bundle
    disableAll/disAll [bundle id] - Disables all components; use [bundle id] to disable all components of the specified bundle

---Kura Logger Commands---
    getkuraloglevel [logger_name] - shows the Kura log level for all loggers, or for a specific logger if specified
    setkuraloglevel (ALL | <logger_name>) <log_level> - sets the Kura log level for a given logger, or all loggers if 'ALL'
        The valid log_level options are: ALL, TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL, OFF

gogo: ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to [Ljava.lang.String;
```

This is because the "createConfiguration" command is not registered properly.
Would be nice to see this fixed for 2.0.0, as it's quite annoying to lose access to the OSGi console help.

I will submit a PR.

issues.title: [Network] dhcpd not restarted when switching from WAN to LAN/DHCP Server mode
issues.body:
On ESF first start, eth0 and wlan0 are configured as dhcp+nat mode, and dhcpd and named services are running.
If the dhcp/nat mode is disabled on the 2 interfaces (eg disabling wlan0 and configuring eth0 as WAN/DHCP client), it is never restored when switching back to LAN/DHCP+NAT server mode. dhcpd and named are never restarted even after rebooting the system.

issues.title: On Red Hat Fedora, network-scripts can contain double quotes
issues.body:
On my Samsung Artik board, `/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0` contains:

```
DEVICE="eth0"
BOOTPROTO="dhcp"
ONBOOT="yes"
TYPE="Ethernet"
PERSISTENT_DHCLIENT="yes"
```

The double-quotes are causing issues e.g in org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.util.GenericNetworkInterface.getCurrentConfig() since `""yes""` is certainly not equal to `"yes"`. I guess org.eclipse.kura.net.admin.visitor.linux.IfcfgConfigReader.parseRedhatConfigFile() could be adapted to remove double-quotes from the parsed properties file?

issues.title: [Web UI] Refresh button in network configuration deselects the currently selected interface
issues.body: The refresh button deselects the currently selected interface, for example wlan0,  and sets it to the loopback interface.

issues.title: [Web UI] Wireless Password disappears after verification
issues.body: In the WiFi configuration, the Wireless Password entered (shown as dots) is deleted after you press the verification button.

issues.title: [Modbus] Implement the MBAP header for TCP/IP communication
issues.body:
According to modbus.org, the MBAP header is required for TCP/IP communication, when sending a PDU. The MBAP header contains transmission ID, protocol identifier, length information and a unit identifier.
Without the header the slave device rejects the transmission when checking the header content. 
See: http://www.modbus.org/docs/Modbus_Messaging_Implementation_Guide_V1_0b.pdf

issues.title: KuraCloudComponent should allow more than 2 topic levels
issues.body: # The code in KuraCloudComponent only allows 2 topic levels (appId/topic) which is fine when using the bridged mode, but this hampers portability if you change the camel route to use native cloud client.  Code in question is [here](https://github.com/eclipse/kura/blob/9701210c393e818c13cc2d4f198b2495139304f7/kura/org.eclipse.kura.camel/src/main/java/org/eclipse/kura/camel/cloud/KuraCloudComponent.java#L44-L44). Discussed this with @hekonsek .

[Web UI] web2 network configuration glitch
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Go to network configuration area
- Select an interface, eth0
- Change a property without hitting Apply
- Select another interface, wlan0
- See "There are unsaved changes..." box
- Click "No"

Expected Behaviour:
We are returned to the eth0 configuration

Actual Behaviour:
The wlan0 interface is selected

issues.title: [Web UI] Inconsistency between expected null value and received "" value
issues.body:
In web 2 the updateDeviceFirewallNATs method of GwtNetworkServiceImpl expects to receive srcNetwork == null and dstNetwork == null to apply default "0.0.0.0/0" values to the corresponding values. The new web2, instead returns "".

The GwtNetworkServiceImpl should cover both null and "" values to match the values received both by the old and new Gwt client part

issues.title: CloudCallServiceImpl - call methods setting requester.client.id to #client-id sends response to local device
issues.body:
I just tried using `CloudCallServiceImpl` to send `CONF-V1` requests to a Kura device. It seems to me that there is a bug in that implementation.

On line 122 it sets the `requester.client.id` to the topic placeholder `#client-id`. This in turn is send to the remote Kura device which then replaces it with its own client-id when sending the response. Not the intended outcome. This prevents the response from ever being picked up by the sender - it subscribes to the correct topic beforehand (using the same placeholder on line 110.

Before looking into a fix for this - am I missing something here? The problem with fixing this is that the client-id isn't available inside that implementation.

I've tested with manually providing the correct client-id on line 122 and that works properly.

Hints?

issues.title: [Configuration] Empty Values In Service Properties
issues.body:
If I set the value of a service property to an empty string in the web UI and hit Apply the empty string is accepted and the corresponding service gets the empty string. When KURA gets restarted the value reverts to the default value from the metatype file. If I change the value to a non empty string the value is preserved across a KURA restart.
I'm changing command.working.directory but see the same behaviour on other properties.

issues.title: Kura NN should not depend on ethtool, bind9, isc-dhcp-server, hostapd
issues.body:
This bug was originally filed at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=476616.

Original Message:

Unless I'm missing something, I believe the "no network" .deb package should not be depending on any networking tool, right?

Agree. 
However, just one exception, it seems that ethtool is still needed for LinuxNetworkUtil bundle to get ethernet MAC address for kura MQTT default client-id.

I am going to use this bug to track bug fixes for the _NN_ installation packages. At present, not only are the networking system dependencies required, but the networking bundles are also being installed and started. This is not the correct behavior and should be corrected.

Thanks,
--Dave

issues.title: Concurrency problem in deployment agent service ?
issues.body:
This bug was originally filed at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=480484.

Original Message:

Hi guys !

We faced of a serious problem with the Deployment Agent service (in all version)

Sometimes this service is blocked and don't deploy our ".dp". Last log we have from the service is : 

2015-10-23 12:59:23,389 [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 6)] INFO  o.e.k.d.a.i.DeploymentAgent - Deploying package name io.stemys.kura.application.shopfloor at URL file:/opt/eclipse/kura/kura/packages/io.stemys.kura.application.shopfloor-0.2.0.dp

And nothing else.

When it's works we have the next log message :

2015-10-23 12:59:23,392 [DeploymentAgent] INFO  o.e.k.d.a.i.DeploymentAgent - About to install package at URL file:/opt/eclipse/kura/kura/packages/io.stemys.kura.application.shopfloor-0.2.0.dp

It's really random. We look at the code to see what is between these two log messages and we think the problem come from the synchronized part on "m_instPackageUrls"

The synchronized part on a ConcurrentLinkedQueue is really necessary ? We remove it and  the problem was resolved for us.

We never saw this problem before but now that we installed Kura on a powerfull device (core i7 / 16 Gb ram / SSD / ...) we have the problem.

Thanks in advance for your job !

Hello,

It is hard to comment on this without knowing your application. I believe the synchronization block is necessary when attempting to install the deployment package. A couple of questions:
1. When you see this issue, are you also getting error in the log files (/var/log/kura.log and /var/log/kura-console.log)?
2. Do you have any potential long running processes in your bundle activate methods? This can often cause issues when activating bundles. 

Thanks,
--Dave

issues.title: getEthernetDriver exception in Kura no network version
issues.body:
This bug was originally reported at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=480606.

Original message:

The nn version will throw out an exception when booting up, caused by not able to get EthernetDriver which is used to get eth0 MAC address for default MQTT client-id (if leave empty in UI setting).

Suggest to add ethtool dependency if possible.

issues.title: iwScantool.java sets invalid values on WifiAccessPoints strength property
Data Service will not connect for other locale than an english one
issues.body:
This bug was originally filed at: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=463915.

Message from original bug:

The data service will not start up/connect once you have a non-english locale defined, since it searches for the keyword „"metric" within the output of ifconfig <interface>. Unfortunately if you have another locale configured, for example german, ifconfig returns "metrik" (german word for metric) and kura fails to parse the output and throws a runtime exception (StringIndexOutOfBoundsException) so that the data service is not available. After changing the locale with raspi-config everything worked fine.

Happened to me on a raspberry pi with raspbian installed.

Also see my blog: http://icanseedeadcats.com/2015/03/24/eclipse-iot-challenge-mqtt-communication-for-hot-desks-featuring-kura-mosquitto-and-paho-and-project-wrapup/

Below is a snippet of the stacktrace:

2015-03-21 20:39:28,330 [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 6)] ERROR o.e.k.c.d.t.
m.MqttDataTransport - Invalid client configuration. Service will not be able to connect until the configuration is updated
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -49
 at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1911)
 at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.util.LinuxNetworkUtil.getCurrentMtu(LinuxNetworkUtil.java:294)
 at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.NetworkServiceImpl.getNetworkInterface(NetworkServiceImpl.java:439)
 at org.eclipse.kura.linux.net.NetworkServiceImpl.getNetworkInterfaces(NetworkServiceImpl.java:314)
 at org.eclipse.kura.core.system.SystemServiceImpl.getPrimaryMacAddress(SystemServiceImpl.java:377)
 at org.eclipse.kura.core.data.transport.mqtt.MqttDataTransport.buildConfiguration(MqttDataTransport.java:633)

issues.title: Intel Edison with Networking Support
issues.body:
Kura with networking support does not work properly with the latest Intel Edison image. Two issues identified thus far:
1. The installation uses the single WiFi interface to set the Edison up as a WiFi Access Point. If a client connects to the access point, the web UI (172.16.1.1:8080/kura) is not operating correctly. The services are not available to configure Kura.
2. The DataTransportService is not being activated correctly. This is likely related to item 1.

Kura: v1.3.0
Intel Edison: Linux edison 3.10.17-poky-edison+

--Dave
